01763                     llvm::BinaryOperator *bop = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BinaryOperator>(v[i]);
01764                     if (bop->getOpcode() == llvm::Instruction::Add)
01765                         addOperandValues[i] = bop->getOperand(operand);
01766                     else
01767                         // The other guys are adds, so we'll treat this as
01768                         // an "add 0" in the below, so just grab the value
01769                         // v[i] itself
01770                         addOperandValues[i] = v[i];
01771                 }
01772 
01773                 if (lVectorValuesAllEqual(addOperandValues)) {
01774                     // If this operand's values are all equal, then the
01775                     // overall result is a linear sequence if the second
01776                     // operand's values are themselves a linear sequence...
01777                     int otherOperand = operand ^ 1;
01778                     for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01779                         llvm::BinaryOperator *bop = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BinaryOperator>(v[i]);
01780                         if (bop->getOpcode() == llvm::Instruction::Add)
01781                             addOperandValues[i] = bop->getOperand(otherOperand);
01782                         else
01783                             addOperandValues[i] = LLVMInt32(0);
01784                     }
01785                     return lVectorIsLinear(addOperandValues, stride);
01786                 }
01787             }
01788         }
01789 
01790         if (bop->getOpcode() == llvm::Instruction::Mul) {
01791             // Finally, if we have a multiply, then if one of the operands
01792             // has the same value for all elements and if the other operand
01793             // is a linear sequence such that the scale times the sequence
01794             // values is a linear sequence with the desired stride, then
01795             // we're good.
01796             llvm::ConstantInt *op0 = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantInt>(bop->getOperand(0));
01797             llvm::ConstantInt *op1 = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantInt>(bop->getOperand(1));
01798 
01799             // We need one of them to be a constant for us to be able to proceed...
01800             if (!op0 && !op1)
01801                 return false;
01802             // But if they're both constants, then the LLVM constant folder
01803             // should have simplified them down to their product!
01804             assert(!(op0 && op1));
01805 
01806             // Figure out which operand number is the constant scale and
01807             // which is the varying one
01808             int scaleOperand, otherOperand;
01809             llvm::ConstantInt *scaleValue;
01810             if (op0 != NULL) {
01811                 scaleOperand = 0;
01812                 otherOperand = 1;
01813                 scaleValue = op0;
01814             }
01815             else {
01816                 scaleOperand = 1;
01817                 otherOperand = 0;
01818                 scaleValue = op1;
01819             }
01820 
01821             // Find the scale value; make sure it evenly divides the
01822             // stride.  Otherwise there's no chance that the scale times a
01823             // set of integer values will give a sequence with the desired
01824             // stride.
01825             int mulScale = (int)scaleValue->getZExtValue();
01826             if ((stride % mulScale) != 0)
01827                 return false;
01828 
01829             llvm::Value *otherValue[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01830             for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i) {
01831                 llvm::BinaryOperator *eltBop = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BinaryOperator>(v[i]);
01832                 // Give up if it's not matching the desired pattern of "all
01833                 // mul ops with the scaleOperand being a constant with the
01834                 // same value".
01835                 if (!eltBop || eltBop->getOpcode() != llvm::Instruction::Mul)
01836                     return false;
01837                 if (eltBop->getOperand(scaleOperand) != scaleValue)
01838                     return false;
01839 
01840                 otherValue[i] = eltBop->getOperand(otherOperand);
01841             }
01842             // Now see if the sequence of values being scaled gives us
01843             // something with the desired stride.
01844             return lVectorIsLinear(otherValue, stride / mulScale);
01845         }
01846     }
01847 
01848     return false;
01849 }
01850 
01851 
01852 bool
01853 GSImprovementsPass::runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &bb) {
01854     llvm::Function *gather32Func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_32");
01855     llvm::Function *gather64Func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_64");
01856     llvm::Function *scatter32Func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_32");
01857     llvm::Function *scatter64Func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_64");
01858     assert(gather32Func && gather64Func && scatter32Func && scatter64Func);
01859 
01860     bool modifiedAny = false;
01861 
01862  restart:
01863     for (llvm::BasicBlock::iterator i = bb.begin(), e = bb.end(); i != e; ++i) {
01864         // Iterate over all of the instructions and look for calls to
01865         // __pseudo_*_base_offsets_* calls.
01866         llvm::CallInst *callInst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::CallInst>(&*i);
01867         if (!callInst || 
01868             (callInst->getCalledFunction() != gather32Func &&
01869              callInst->getCalledFunction() != gather64Func &&
01870              callInst->getCalledFunction() != scatter32Func &&
01871              callInst->getCalledFunction() != scatter64Func))
01872             continue;
01873 
01874         SourcePos pos;
01875         bool ok = lGetSourcePosFromMetadata(callInst, &pos);
01876         assert(ok);     
01877 
01878         bool isGather = (callInst->getCalledFunction() == gather32Func ||
01879                          callInst->getCalledFunction() == gather64Func);
01880         bool is32 = (callInst->getCalledFunction() == gather32Func ||
01881                      callInst->getCalledFunction() == scatter32Func);
01882 
01883         // Get the actual base pointer; note that it comes into the gather
01884         // or scatter function bitcast to an i8 *, so we need to work back
01885         // to get the pointer as the original type.
01886         llvm::Value *base = callInst->getArgOperand(0);
01887         llvm::BitCastInst *bci = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::BitCastInst>(base);
01888         if (bci)
01889             base = bci->getOperand(0);
01890         llvm::ConstantExpr *ce = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ConstantExpr>(base);
01891         if (ce && ce->getOpcode() == llvm::Instruction::BitCast)
01892             base = ce->getOperand(0);
01893 
01894         // Try to out the offsets; the i'th element of the offsetElements
01895         // array should be an i32 with the value of the offset for the i'th
01896         // vector lane.  This may fail; if so, just give up.
01897         llvm::Value *offsetElements[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01898         if (!lScalarizeVector(callInst->getArgOperand(1), offsetElements))
01899             continue;
01900 
01901         llvm::Value *mask = callInst->getArgOperand(isGather ? 2 : 3);
01902 
01903         if (lVectorValuesAllEqual(offsetElements)) {
01904             // If all the offsets are equal, then compute the single
01905             // pointer they all represent based on the first one of them
01906             // (arbitrarily).
01907             llvm::Value *indices[1] = { offsetElements[0] };
01908             llvm::Value *basei8 =
01909                 new llvm::BitCastInst(base, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, "base2i8", callInst);
01910             lCopyMetadata(basei8, callInst);
01911             llvm::Value *ptr = 
01912                 llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(basei8, &indices[0], &indices[1],
01913                                                 "ptr", callInst);
01914             lCopyMetadata(ptr, callInst);
01915 
01916             if (isGather) {
01917                 // A gather with everyone going to the same location is
01918                 // handled as a scalar load and broadcast across the lanes.
01919                 // Note that we do still have to pass the mask to the
01920                 // __load_and_broadcast_* functions, since they shouldn't
01921                 // access memory if the mask is all off (the location may
01922                 // be invalid in that case).
01923                 Debug(pos, "Transformed gather to scalar load and broadcast!");
01924                 llvm::Function *loadBroadcast = 
01925                     m->module->getFunction(is32 ? "__load_and_broadcast_32" :
01926                                                   "__load_and_broadcast_64");
01927                 assert(loadBroadcast);
01928                 llvm::Value *args[2] = { ptr, mask };
01929                 llvm::Instruction *newCall = 
01930                     llvm::CallInst::Create(loadBroadcast, &args[0], &args[2],
01931                                            "load_broadcast");
01932                 lCopyMetadata(newCall, callInst);
01933                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithInst(callInst, newCall);
01934             }
01935             else {
01936                 // A scatter with everyone going to the same location is
01937                 // undefined.  Issue a warning and arbitrarily let the
01938                 // first guy win.
01939                 Warning(pos, "Undefined behavior: all program instances are "
01940                         "writing to the same location!");
01941 
01942                 llvm::Value *rvalue = callInst->getArgOperand(2);
01943                 llvm::Value *first = 
01944                     llvm::ExtractElementInst::Create(rvalue, LLVMInt32(0), "rvalue_first",
01945                                                      callInst);
01946                 lCopyMetadata(first, callInst);
01947                 ptr = new llvm::BitCastInst(ptr, llvm::PointerType::get(first->getType(), 0),
01948                                             "ptr2rvalue_type", callInst);
01949                 lCopyMetadata(ptr, callInst);
01950                 llvm::Instruction *sinst = 
01951                     new llvm::StoreInst(first, ptr, false, is32 ? 4 : 8 /* align */);
01952                 lCopyMetadata(sinst, callInst);
01953                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithInst(callInst, sinst);
01954             }
01955 
01956             modifiedAny = true;
01957             goto restart;
01958         }
01959 
01960         if (lVectorIsLinear(offsetElements, is32 ? 4 : 8)) {
01961             // We have a linear sequence of memory locations being accessed
01962             // starting with the location given by the offset from
01963             // offsetElements[0], with stride of 4 or 8 bytes (for 32 bit
01964             // and 64 bit gather/scatters, respectively.)
01965 
01966             // Get the base pointer using the first guy's offset.
01967             llvm::Value *indices[2] = { offsetElements[0] };
01968             llvm::Value *basei8 =
01969                 new llvm::BitCastInst(base, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType, "base2i8", callInst);
01970             lCopyMetadata(basei8, callInst);
01971             llvm::Value *ptr = 
01972                 llvm::GetElementPtrInst::Create(basei8, &indices[0], &indices[1],
01973                                                 "ptr", callInst);
01974             lCopyMetadata(ptr, callInst);
01975 
01976             if (isGather) {
01977                 Debug(pos, "Transformed gather to unaligned vector load!");
01978                 // FIXME: make this an aligned load when possible..
01979                 // FIXME: are there lurking potential bugs when e.g. the
01980                 // last few entries of the mask are off and the load ends
01981                 // up straddling a page boundary?
01982                 llvm::Function *loadMasked = 
01983                     m->module->getFunction(is32 ? "__load_masked_32" : "__load_masked_64");
01984                 assert(loadMasked);
01985 
01986                 llvm::Value *args[2] = { ptr, mask };
01987                 llvm::Instruction *newCall = 
01988                     llvm::CallInst::Create(loadMasked, &args[0], &args[2], "load_masked");
01989                 lCopyMetadata(newCall, callInst);
01990                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithInst(callInst, newCall);
01991             }
01992             else {
01993                 Debug(pos, "Transformed scatter to unaligned vector store!");
01994                 // FIXME: make this an aligned store when possible.  Need
01995                 // to work through the messiness of issuing a pseudo store
01996                 // here.
01997                 llvm::Value *rvalue = callInst->getArgOperand(2);
01998 
01999                 llvm::Function *storeMasked = 
02000                     m->module->getFunction(is32 ? "__pseudo_masked_store_32" :
02001                                                   "__pseudo_masked_store_64");
02002                 assert(storeMasked);
02003                 const llvm::Type *vecPtrType = is32 ?
02004                     LLVMTypes::Int32VectorPointerType : LLVMTypes::Int64VectorPointerType;
02005                 ptr = new llvm::BitCastInst(ptr, vecPtrType, "ptrcast", callInst);
02006 
02007                 llvm::Value *args[3] = { ptr, rvalue, mask };
02008                 llvm::Instruction *newCall = 
02009                     llvm::CallInst::Create(storeMasked, &args[0], &args[3], "");
02010                 lCopyMetadata(newCall, callInst);
02011                 llvm::ReplaceInstWithInst(callInst, newCall);
02012             }
02013 
02014             modifiedAny = true;
02015             goto restart;
02016         }
02017 
02018 #if 0
02019         lPrintVector("scatter/gather no love: flattened", offsetElements);
02020         bb.dump();
02021 #endif
02022     }
02023 
02024     return modifiedAny;
02025 }
02026 
02027 
02028 static llvm::Pass *
02029 CreateGatherScatterImprovementsPass() {
02030     return new GSImprovementsPass;
02031 }
02032 
02033 
02034 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
02035 // LowerGSPass
02036 
02037 /** For any gathers and scatters remaining after the GSImprovementsPass
02038     runs, we need to turn them into actual native gathers and scatters.
02039     This task is handled by the LowerGSPass here.
02040  */
02041 class LowerGSPass : public llvm::BasicBlockPass {
02042 public:
02043     static char ID;
02044     LowerGSPass() : BasicBlockPass(ID) { }
02045 
02046     const char *getPassName() const { return "Gather/Scatter Improvements"; }
02047     bool runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &BB);
02048 };
02049 
02050 
02051 char LowerGSPass::ID = 0;
02052 
02053 llvm::RegisterPass<LowerGSPass> lgs("lower-gs",
02054                                     "Lower Gather/Scatter Pass");
02055 
02056 bool
02057 LowerGSPass::runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &bb) {
02058     llvm::Function *gather32Func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_32");
02059     llvm::Function *gather64Func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_gather_base_offsets_64");
02060     llvm::Function *scatter32Func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_32");
02061     llvm::Function *scatter64Func = m->module->getFunction("__pseudo_scatter_base_offsets_64");
02062     assert(gather32Func && gather64Func && scatter32Func && scatter64Func);
02063 
02064     bool modifiedAny = false;
02065  restart:
02066     for (llvm::BasicBlock::iterator i = bb.begin(), e = bb.end(); i != e; ++i) {
02067         // Loop over the instructions and find calls to the
02068         // __pseudo_*_base_offsets_* functions.
02069         llvm::CallInst *callInst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::CallInst>(&*i);
02070         if (!callInst || 
02071             (callInst->getCalledFunction() != gather32Func &&
02072              callInst->getCalledFunction() != gather64Func &&
02073              callInst->getCalledFunction() != scatter32Func &&
02074              callInst->getCalledFunction() != scatter64Func))
02075             continue;
02076 
02077         bool isGather = (callInst->getCalledFunction() == gather32Func ||
02078                          callInst->getCalledFunction() == gather64Func);
02079         bool is32 = (callInst->getCalledFunction() == gather32Func ||
02080                      callInst->getCalledFunction() == scatter32Func);
02081 
02082         // Get the source position from the metadata attached to the call
02083         // instruction so that we can issue PerformanceWarning()s below.
02084         SourcePos pos;
02085         bool ok = lGetSourcePosFromMetadata(callInst, &pos);
02086         assert(ok);     
02087 
02088         if (isGather) {
02089             llvm::Function *gFunc = m->module->getFunction(is32 ? "__gather_base_offsets_i32" :
02090                                                                   "__gather_base_offsets_i64");
02091             assert(gFunc);
02092             callInst->setCalledFunction(gFunc);
02093             PerformanceWarning(pos, "Gather required to compute value in expression.");
02094         }
02095         else {
02096             llvm::Function *sFunc = m->module->getFunction(is32 ? "__scatter_base_offsets_i32" :
02097                                                                   "__scatter_base_offsets_i64");
02098             assert(sFunc);
02099             callInst->setCalledFunction(sFunc);
02100             PerformanceWarning(pos, "Scatter required for storing value.");
02101         }
02102         modifiedAny = true;
02103         goto restart;
02104     }
02105     return modifiedAny;
02106 }
02107 
02108 
02109 static llvm::Pass *
02110 CreateLowerGatherScatterPass() {
02111     return new LowerGSPass;
02112 }
02113 
02114 
02115 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
02116 // IsCompileTimeConstantPass
02117 
02118 /** LLVM IR implementations of target-specific functions may include calls
02119     to the functions "bool __is_compile_time_constant_mask(mask type)" and
02120     "bool __is_compile_time_constant_int32(i32)"; these allow them to have
02121     specialied code paths for where the corresponding value is known at
02122     compile time.  For masks, for example, this allows them to not incur
02123     the cost of a MOVMSK call at runtime to compute its value in cases
02124     where the mask value isn't known until runtime.
02125 
02126     This pass resolves these calls into either 'true' or 'false' values so
02127     that later optimization passes can operate with these as constants.
02128 
02129     See stdlib.m4 for a number of uses of this idiom. 
02130  */
02131 
02132 class IsCompileTimeConstantPass : public llvm::BasicBlockPass {
02133 public:
02134     static char ID;
02135     IsCompileTimeConstantPass(bool last = false) : BasicBlockPass(ID) {
02136         isLastTry = last;
02137     }
02138 
02139     const char *getPassName() const { return "Resolve \"is compile time constant\""; }
02140     bool runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &BB);
02141 
02142     bool isLastTry;
02143 };
02144 
02145 char IsCompileTimeConstantPass::ID = 0;
02146 
02147 llvm::RegisterPass<IsCompileTimeConstantPass> 
02148     ctcrp("compile-time-constant", "Compile-Time Constant Resolve Pass");
02149 
02150 bool
02151 IsCompileTimeConstantPass::runOnBasicBlock(llvm::BasicBlock &bb) {
02152     llvm::Function *maskFunc = m->module->getFunction("__is_compile_time_constant_mask");
02153     llvm::Function *int32Func = m->module->getFunction("__is_compile_time_constant_int32");
02154 
02155     bool modifiedAny = false;
02156  restart:
02157     for (llvm::BasicBlock::iterator i = bb.begin(), e = bb.end(); i != e; ++i) {
02158         // Iterate through the instructions looking for calls to the
02159         // __is_compile_time_constant_*() functions
02160         llvm::CallInst *callInst = llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::CallInst>(&*i);
02161         if (!callInst || (callInst->getCalledFunction() != maskFunc &&
02162                           callInst->getCalledFunction() != int32Func))
02163             continue;
02164 
02165         // This optimization pass can be disabled with the (poorly named)
02166         // disableGatherScatterFlattening option.
02167         if (g->opt.disableGatherScatterFlattening) {
02168             llvm::ReplaceInstWithValue(i->getParent()->getInstList(), i, LLVMFalse);
02169             modifiedAny = true;
02170             goto restart;
02171         }
02172 
02173         // Is it a constant?  Bingo, turn the call's value into a constant
02174         // true value.
02175         llvm::Value *operand = callInst->getArgOperand(0);
02176         if (llvm::isa<llvm::Constant>(operand)) {
02177             llvm::ReplaceInstWithValue(i->getParent()->getInstList(), i, LLVMTrue);
02178             modifiedAny = true;
02179             goto restart;
02180         }
02181 
02182         // This pass runs multiple times during optimization.  Up until the
02183         // very last time, it only replaces the call with a 'true' if the
02184         // value is known to be constant and otherwise leaves the call
02185         // alone, in case further optimization passes can help resolve its
02186         // value.  The last time through, it eventually has to give up, and
02187         // replaces any remaining ones with 'false' constants.
02188         if (isLastTry) {
02189             llvm::ReplaceInstWithValue(i->getParent()->getInstList(), i, LLVMFalse);
02190             modifiedAny = true;
02191             goto restart;
02192         }
02193     }
02194 
02195     return modifiedAny;
02196 }
02197 
02198 
02199 static llvm::Pass *
02200 CreateIsCompileTimeConstantPass(bool isLastTry) {
02201     return new IsCompileTimeConstantPass(isLastTry);
02202 }
02203 
02204 
02205 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
02206 // MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass
02207 
02208 /** There are a number of target-specific functions that we use during
02209     these optimization passes.  By the time we are done with optimization,
02210     any uses of these should be inlined and no calls to these functions
02211     should remain.  This pass marks all of these functions as having
02212     private linkage so that subsequent passes can eliminate them as dead
02213     code, thus cleaning up the final code output by the compiler.  We can't
02214     just declare these as static from the start, however, since then they
02215     end up being eliminated as dead code during early optimization passes
02216     even though we may need to generate calls to them during later
02217     optimization passes.
02218  */
02219 class MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass : public llvm::ModulePass {
02220 public:
02221     static char ID;
02222     MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass(bool last = false) : ModulePass(ID) {
02223     }
02224 
02225     const char *getPassName() const { return "Make internal funcs \"static\""; }
02226     bool runOnModule(llvm::Module &m);
02227 };
02228 
02229 char MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass::ID = 0;
02230 
02231 llvm::RegisterPass<MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass> 
02232   mifsp("make-internal-funcs-static", "Make Internal Funcs Static Pass");
02233 
02234 bool
02235 MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass::runOnModule(llvm::Module &module) {
02236     const char *names[] = {
02237         "__do_print", "__gather_base_offsets_i32", "__gather_base_offsets_i64",
02238         "__gather_elt_32", "__gather_elt_64", "__load_and_broadcast_32", 
02239         "__load_and_broadcast_64", "__load_masked_32", "__load_masked_64",
02240         "__masked_store_32", "__masked_store_64", "__masked_store_blend_32",
02241         "__masked_store_blend_64", "__packed_load_active", "__packed_store_active",
02242         "__scatter_base_offsets_i32", "__scatter_base_offsets_i64", "__scatter_elt_32",
02243         "__scatter_elt_64", };
02244 
02245     int count = sizeof(names) / sizeof(names[0]);
02246     for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
02247         llvm::Function *f = m->module->getFunction(names[i]);
02248         if (f != NULL)
02249             f->setLinkage(llvm::GlobalValue::PrivateLinkage);
02250     }
02251 
02252     return true;
02253 }

02256 static llvm::Pass *
02257 CreateMakeInternalFuncsStaticPass() {
02258     return new MakeInternalFuncsStaticPass;
